Explore Student Materials

Item from Box 1 Form(s) of Energy Observed

Hand WarmerThermal
BatteryElectrical
RulerSound
Glow StickLight
UV BeadsLight
Pop Rock CandySound
ScissorsMechanical

Question 1

Each item produced one form of energy.

Question 2

Through observation I can tell what form of energy is being produced. If it makes light, it is light energy. If the object makes a noise, then it is sound energy. If an object creates heat, then it is thermal energy. And if an object has moving parts to make it work, it has mechanical energy.

Item from Box 2Form(s) of Energy Observed
Handheld FanMechanical, Sound, Electric
Christmas Tree LightsLight, Thermal, Electric
CellphoneElectric, Sound, Light, Thermal
RadioSound, Electrical, Mechanical
TVLight, Sound, Thermal, Electrical
LampLight, Electrical, Thermal
Electric Pencil SharpenerMechanical, Electric, Sound
Question 3

The items in box two had more than one type of energy either produced or used, the items in box one only had one form of energy.

Question 4

The TV and the cell phone each used or produced four types of energy.

Question 5

Dishwasher: electrical, heat, sound, mechanical
Stapler: mechanical and sound
Car: electrical, sound, and mechanical

Part III: Find an Item
Question 1
Question 2

We use energy in everything we do. Light energy provides us entertainment in watching TV and listening to the radio through sound energy. We use thermal energy in our heaters to keep us warm and electrical energy to provide us with power.

Question 3

Energy is important because most of our machines require and produce energy. Without energy we would not be able to communicate and move around.

Open-Ended Response Assessment

Question 1

Answers may vary. Solar energy can be taken in by solar panels on homes or streetlights and be turned into electrical energy that can be used to power things like the oven. The oven then creates thermal energy.

Question 2

Answers may vary. Energy from electricity runs through the fan, this energy is then changed into kinetic energy as the blades of the fan turn, this creates wind energy.

Question 3

Answers may vary. Electrical energy is the most important to me. It helps power almost everything I do. It keeps my computer running. It allows my mom to cook me food. It keeps our house cool in the summer. It keeps my night light on at night.

Writing Science

Answers may vary. These are string instruments, so you need to pluck the strings in order to make them make sound. The strings are the main part that produces sound, and you do not play any other part of the instrument, so the strings must be the only part that produces sound. You can make the sound louder or quieter by plucking the strings harder or softer.

Claim-Evidence-Reasoning

Mechanical, electrical, light, and thermal energies are being used when making cookies. *Note: Sound energy is produced, but it is not involved in the actual process of making the cookies.

  1. The mixer blades use mechanical energy to turn.
  2. Mechanical energy is needed to move the cookie dough to the cookie sheet.
  3. It takes mechanical energy to open the door of the oven. The oven uses thermal energy to bake the cookies, and there is a light (light energy) that comes on in the oven.
  4. The mixer and the oven work because of electricity (electrical energy).

Mechanical energy is the energy of movement. The blades move, and it takes movement to use the spoon and open the oven door.

The mixer and the oven need electricity to operate.

We can feel the heat from the oven that is needed to bake the cookies, which is thermal energy.

The oven door acts like a light switch. When the door opens, the light bulb turns on.

Section: Intervention
Guided Practice

Alarm Clock - mechanical, sound
Bicycle - mechanical
Boom Box - sound, mechanical
Camera - light, sound, mechanical
Chattering Teeth - mechanical, sound
Hair Dryer - electrical, sound, thermal
Lamp - electrical, light, thermal
Recorder - sound
Spinning Top - mechanical
Sun - light , thermal
Toaster - electrical, light, thermal, sound
Tractor - mechanical, thermal, sound
TV - electrical, light, thermal, sound
Weather Vane - mechanical
